data.prayer: Father, please make every disciple be a disciple maker, every home a training center, and every church a church planting movement in the state of Chaguanas.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Chaguanas, Trinidad and Tobago
data.section_summary: What challenges do people here face?

data.prayer: Father, like with the Ethiopian Eunuch, set up a meeting today between a faithful believer in Chaguanas, Trinidad and Tobago and a person seeking to understand the truth.
data.verse: The eunuch asked Philip, “Tell me, please, who is the prophet talking about, himself or someone else?” Then Philip began with that very passage of Scripture and told him the good news about Jesus.

data.prayer: Lord, raise up apostolic workers to plant churches in every town in the state of Chaguanas.
data.verse: The reason I left you in Crete was that you might put in order what was left unfinished and appoint elders in every town, as I directed you.

data.prayer: Spirit, sanctify the 19,717 believers in Chaguanas and keep them blameless until Jesus returns.
data.verse: May the God of peace himself sanctify you completely. May your whole spirit, soul, and body be preserved blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ. He who calls you is faithful, who will also do it.

data.prayer: Father, your Word is essential for life and growth. Please challenge the 36,160 cultural Christians in the state of Chaguanas to read your Word for themselves today.
data.verse: It is written: 'Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that comes from the mouth of God.'

data.prayer: Father, move the 19,717 believers in the state of Chaguanas to say "Not our will, but yours be done", like Jesus.
data.verse: He withdrew about a stone’s throw beyond them, knelt down and prayed, "Father, if you are willing, take this cup from me; yet not my will, but yours be done."

data.prayer: God, we ask you to raise up elders and deacons from the 19,717 believers in Chaguanas, who will serve the church and equip it to do your work.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up until we all reach unity in the faith and in the knowledge of the Son of God and become mature, attaining to the whole measure of the fullness of Christ.
